column4: hello, good evening! i have a short question. i installed ubuntu 8.04 on the old computer of my father. but i'm not satified with the resolution of 800x600 ? how can i change it?
install the drivers for your graphics card
thats the problem! i don't know how to do.
i do not even know the name of the graphic card
look in the system menu and there should be a device drivers listed, click that and ubuntu might already have a driver available
there is a menu  "Hardware-driver"; and than theres written there are no properitie drivers on your system
sorry had to go get my laptop w/ ubuntu (this computer is too slow to run it)
in the terminal of the computer do an lspci and copy what is sent back to pastebin then give me the url
i'm not sure if i understood well
do the same thing only this time run "dmesg"
from your lspci print out it looks like "ATI Technologies Inc Rage 128 RL/VR AGP" is your graphics card
and you don't have options higher than 800x600 in the screen resolution selection right? (i assumed this by accident)
yes i don't have options higher than 800x600; what can i do?
what do i have to do? which driver?
